reviews.customers_say: Customers find the merino wool shirt keeps them warm and comfortable next to the skin, with a generous length that works well under dress shirts.

items.title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Absolutely Impressed!
items.body: I purchased this Midweight Minus33 XXL top and the matching Minus33 Mindweight XXL bottoms a while ago for to take on a week long elk hunting trip into the great alpine wilderness of Eastern Washington. I knew it was going to be COLD up there and I am not someone that easily stays warm in the elements. Cutting wind, snow, ice, frigid rain... you never know what is happening next. I decided to save my review until after I'd put these to the test. I was looking for 100% wool base layers in something my size and was very pleased to find these, not only in my size, but made for a woman. Bless you, Minus33!! I've spent a lot of very cold, miserable winters wearing other "thermals" that either didn't help at all or made me sweat so much becuase they did not breathe that I was uncomfortable and froze anyway. They seem to be well made, I found no flaws in the initial "once over" nor after I put them on and wore them. I had no issue with the elastic as one person had reviewed. They wore well and laundered nicely... even in a bucket of ice cold stream water, being poked with a stick and hung over the camp stove to dry... if you can call that laundering. Both the top and bottoms came in the mail quickly, and when I tried them on, I was very pleasantly surprised. It was SO nice to put these on and have them fit so well. I am long through the body and tall, and these fit like they were custom cut for me. Stretchy and cozy, I was immediately happy. The crew top was long enough in the hem to fit my long body nicely and the sleeve was long enough that the cuffs actually came down to my wrists. The bottoms were also cut nicely, long enough for my long legs, fit me VERY well all around, perfect through the butt and crotch, waist line high enough to not worry about "cracking out" when I bend over, which has always been the price of having to wear men's thermals (not to mention no "front door" to have to sew shut!). The material did feel just a little bit itchy when I first yanked them out of the package and tried them on, but that went away after a gentle wash and dry. I can honestly say that these Minus33 100% wool, midweight base layers made all the difference in the world this last season. NEVER before have I been actually WARM when out in the elements for any length of time. The 5 mile hike up into camp in a foot of snow would have rendered me a sweaty, wet, frozen mess before but this time I was comfortable and toasty, even when we stopped to rest and cooled down. I had packed polar fleece thermals with me just in case these weren't enough, but those never made it out of the pack. I was so toasty in these, I often just wore them by themselves with a down vest for hiking around in, carrying my heavy outer wear in a back pack to put on over them when I got to where I would be sitting. They really proved their worth in the wet, too. One morning I slipped, lost my footing, and fell into the creek and had to hike back to camp just wearing them, carrying my outerwear and my gear. My boots were soaked but I was also wearing 100% wool socks. I wasn't exactly warm along the way but I wasn't frozen by the time I got to camp. My Dad was an ice fisherman and he always, ALWAYS wore his wool and told me that there was nothing better, especially if you ended up wet. I wish I'd have listened to him years ago, I wouldn't have spent so many winters shivering. These came home in great shape after a week of crawling around in the elements being worn constantly as under wear and as only wear. I literally lived in these things and wouldn't hesitate to buy another set. Thank you, Minus33 for an absolutely outstanding product. Read more
items.author: Wylfenne

items.title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very nice top and very soft - 100% Merino Wool!
items.body: We are hunters and we have a big vacation planned in the near future going to Yellowstone National Park in the Winter. I live in Louisiana where our cold is a wet cold. But in Montana it is a dry cold. After reading many informative documents on how to dress for the cold and the extreme cold in Montana, I knew I needed to purchase some clothing made from Merino Wool. Merino wool wicks perspiration away from the skin. I don't need my my husband getting out in the cold and getting wet only to get pneumonia! Keeping dry helps to avoid hypothermia in the winter. I ordered this top for myself in the Charcoal color in large. The fit is perfect. I will be using these as my base layer. This top is lightweight not bulky like I thought it would be. It is very soft and comfortable – not itchy at all. When I think of wool, I think of the heavy, thick, itchy, bulky material but not this 100% Merino Wool. The stitching is done perfectly. These have flat lock seams to prevent chafing. I washed mine as soon as I received them in cold water and tumbled in the dryer on low. I have tried them on and I am very pleased with them. These are made for women with the curve around the waist. I have not had the opportunity to wear these in the cold yet – still 100 degrees here in Louisiana but I have been wearing them in the house just to make sure they fit and are comfortable. They have passed that test and they are very warm but I can't wear them for long right now. I highly recommend this product. I paid full price for this item but a day after I purchased these, the price went up. Read more
items.author: Karen

items.title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nice piece to own
items.body: Was light weight and warm for my 100 mile river rafting trip and I wear it a lot due to warmth and comfort. Read more
items.author: Shawn McComb

items.title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect Wool Shirt
items.body: I love this shirt - I got the size medium, which is the size I normally wear, and it fit perfectly. This is meant to be a base layer (undershirt) but can be worn on its own as well and still look good. The thickness is perfect so as not to be too hot but warm enough. I have worn this backpacking and pretty much every day during the winter this year. It looks flattering with just about anything and can be dressed up or down easily. The best part is feeling warm and cozy when everyone in cotton is freezing :D I liked the fact that when I wore it to sleep in while backpacking, even though I got hot during the night I never got clammy and was able to open the sleeping bag a bit and get comfortable. With cotton, I would have had to change shirts after sweating. The shirt dried right out and I felt comfortable, and it didn't even stink after multiple days of wearing it. It is totally worth the price! Read more
items.author: Woodland Wanderer

items.title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable and cozy
items.body: I wore this shirt in red to Scotland and Norway. I liked it so much that I bought it in two other colors It was comfortable, kept me warm, and looked nice. Read more
items.author: Kindle Customer

items.title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Super nice quality
items.body: Super nice! Very nice quality medium weight merino under layer. It feels soft and substantial. I expect that it will be very durable. Quality stitching. I plan to machine wash gentle and drape over a drying rack to dry. I have other merino clothing and this seems to work well and dries fast. I am 5'4", 148 lbs and bought size medium. Read more
items.author: My Stuff

short_description:
Womens Maxi Dress Long Sleeve is made for a polished look that still feels comfortable to wear. It is designed to sit cleanly on the body with a flattering shape that works for day plans and dressier moments without feeling overdone.

The fit focuses on balance rather than extremes, so you can move naturally while still getting a defined silhouette. Choose your usual size for a closer look, or size up if you prefer a little more ease through the waist and hips.

Styling is simple: keep accessories minimal for a clean finish, or add a jacket and statement shoes when you want a sharper outfit. This piece photographs well thanks to smooth lines and a structured feel that stays put once you have it adjusted.

With the right fit and simple styling, this item becomes an easy go-to when you want something that looks intentional without requiring extra effort.

The design is easy to style with simple accessories and works well in photos thanks to clean lines and a balanced silhouette.

This piece transitions well from daytime plans to evening events with a quick change of shoes and a small bag or clutch.

long_description:
Womens Maxi Dress Long Sleeve is a versatile piece you can reach for when you want a put-together look that still feels comfortable. The goal is simple: a silhouette that reads polished, photographs well, and stays wearable for a full day or a long night.

Fit and sizing Fit is where most outfits win or lose. This design aims for a balanced shape with a defined line through the torso, a clean waist, and a smooth finish through the hips and legs. If you prefer a more relaxed feel, size up; if you like a closer fit, stay true to size. Sizes may include: One Size.

Fabric and comfort Comfort is not just about softness. It is also about movement and how the fabric behaves as you walk, sit, and stand. A fabric blend with a bit of give helps it keep its shape while still feeling wearable.

Highlights A clean neckline and a refined silhouette for an elevated look. Designed to layer easily with jackets, wraps, or sweaters. Works well with both minimal accessories and statement pieces.

How to style Styling ideas: keep it minimal with neutral shoes and one standout accessory. For a relaxed daytime look, add a denim jacket or cardigan. For events, switch to a bolder shoe and a small clutch for a sharper finish.

Color notes Available colors may include: 235 Midweight Charcoal Gray Black, 235 Midweight Navy Blue, 170 Lightweight True Red, 235 Midweight True Red, 235 Midweight Black, 235 Midweight Natural Cream, 235 Midweight Forest Green, 170 Lightweight Black, 235 Midweight Mossy Oak, 170 Lightweight Charcoal Gray, 235 Midweight Burgundy, 235 Midweight Charcoal Gray, 400 Expedition Burgundy, 400 Expedition Black. If a shade is sold out, check back as availability can change.

Care Care guidance matters if you want it to keep its shape and finish. Follow the label first.
